entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Native debugging documentation, private constructor warning fixes, compaction integrity improvements, and variance syntax documentation.
entry.content:
Summary

Major documentation updates, compiler warnings improvements, build system fixes, and ongoing large-scale feature development.

Activity

  • New PRs opened include filter_mapi function for stdlib by Emile Trotignon (#14227), Merlin's typing recovery integration by Xavier Van de Woestyne (#14241), and relocatable OCaml implementation by David Allsopp (#14244, #14245)
  • Android cross-build fixes merged by Antonin DÃ©cimo addressing undeclared function errors and updating GitHub Actions workflows (#14240)
  • Build system improvements included Makefile variable scoping fixes by Damien Doligez (#14231), ocamltest linking criterion fixes (#14230), and test-in-prefix workflow corrections (#14216)
  • AppVeyor CI updates by David Allsopp fixed testsuite skipping and added mingw-runtime version reporting (#14242)
  • Active development continues on Windows concurrency primitives migration (#13416), transparent ascription feature implementation (#14064), and as-pattern existential handling (#14229)
entry.summary: Native debugging documentation, private constructor warning fixes, compaction integrity improvements, and variance syntax documentation.

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Week focused on C++ compatibility fixes, error message improvements, and new stdlib function proposals
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple new PRs opened including stdlib additions and GADT improvements, with several bug fixes merged

Activity

  • New standard library function proposed by Emile Trotignon adding filter_mapi function to combine filtering and mapping with indices (#14227)
  • Relocatable OCaml initiative advanced with David Allsopp opening comprehensive PR for opam integration and installation mechanism improvements (#14246)
  • GADT existentials support enhanced by Olivier Nicole allowing retyping of as-patterns containing existentials (#14229)
  • Variance syntax documentation merged by Takafumi Saikawa explaining bivariance indicators introduced in earlier releases (#14126)
  • Initialization flag improvements in progress by Emile Trotignon making -init work correctly with -e flag (#14190)
  • Private constructor warnings fixed by Gabriel Scherer silencing unused-constructor warnings for private variant constructors (#14225)
entry.summary: Week focused on C++ compatibility fixes, error message improvements, and new stdlib function proposals

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Memory model fixes for weak arrays, new List.split_map function, and improved error messages for functors and debugger tools.
entry.content:
Summary

Five new PRs opened including error message fixes and TSan improvements, alongside twelve PRs merged addressing memory model and developer experience.

Activity

  • Five new PRs opened this week including inclusion check error message improvements by Liam Stevenson (#14205), runtime flag compatibility by Damien Doligez (#14211), and TSan shadow stack fixes by Olivier Nicole (#14213)
  • Memory synchronization improvements delivered through fast-tracked weak array fixes addressing persistent CI failures (#14209), ephemeron data race resolution (#14210), and TSan test updates (#14203)
  • Developer experience enhancements through debugger path mapping improvements (#14055), better functor error messages (#14215), and module unpacking constraint fixes (#14198)
  • Standard library additions including the new List.split_map function (#14185) and runtime system optimizations for ephemeron handling (#14175)
  • Platform-specific fixes for NetBSD pthread compatibility (#14208) and minor documentation corrections in Format module (#14194)
entry.summary: Memory model fixes for weak arrays, new List.split_map function, and improved error messages for functors and debugger tools.

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Runtime events documentation improvements and several bug fixes with new PRs for major language features
entry.content:
Summary

Five new PRs opened including Dependabot setup and interprocedural tail call flags, plus multiple merged bug fixes

Activity

  • Five new PRs opened this week including Dependabot setup for GitHub Actions by Sora Morimoto (#14199), interprocedural tail call optimization flag by Adam Dingle (#14186), and include functor structure-only feature by Olivier Nicole (#14177)
  • Bug fixes merged including variance check fix for private aliases by Jacques Garrigue (#14202), module unpacking constraint handling by Thomas Refis (#14198), and ocamlprof refutation case fix by Gabriel Scherer (#14197)
  • Runtime events improvements delivered through merged PR by Tim McGilchrist adding new word-based counters and documentation clarifications (#14189)
  • Thread sanitizer test fixes merged by Damien Doligez to account for previous changes (#14203)
  • Toplevel printing restoration merged by Florian Angeletti for qualified labels (#14192)
  • Major ongoing work continues on transparent ascription feature split (#14064), modular explicits documentation (#14048), and Git archive optimization for opam installations (#14152)
entry.summary: Runtime events documentation improvements and several bug fixes with new PRs for major language features

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Fix for toplevel printing and GC runtime improvements merged alongside 8 new PRs covering features and tooling enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Eight new PRs opened covering init file handling, tail call optimization, documentation fixes, and runtime improvements

Activity

  • Eight new PRs opened this week including -init flag fixes by Emile Trotignon (#14190), tail call optimization control by Adam Dingle (#14186), and GC documentation clarification by Tim McGilchrist (#14191)
  • Standard library enhancement with List.split_map function merged by Jeremy Yallop (#14185)
  • Runtime events fixes merged by Tim McGilchrist addressing counter reporting in bytes vs words (#14189)
  • Documentation improvements with Format module typo fixes merged by Leo Lee (#14194)
  • Ongoing development on transparent ascription features (#14064) and modular explicits documentation (#14048)
entry.summary: Fix for toplevel printing and GC runtime improvements merged alongside 8 new PRs covering features and tooling enhancements

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: Type system fixes and error message improvements with active contributor discussions on language features
entry.content:
Summary

Three new issues opened exploring language features while ongoing PRs advance installation improvements and type system work

Activity

  • New issues opened this week include Jean-Christophe Filliatre exploring generative functor limitations (#14183), type propagation improvements by @rr0gi (#14182), and Kate reporting toplevel printer regression (#14184)
  • Installation improvements progressing through David Allsopp's git archive optimization work to reduce OCaml package size for opam installations (#14152)
  • Type system development continues with Stefan Muenzel's proxy type refactoring for Out_type (#14156) and Olivier Nicole's include functor feature implementation (#14177)
  • Documentation updates merged with Takafumi Saikawa documenting bivariance indicators syntax changes (#14126)
entry.summary: Type system fixes and error message improvements with active contributor discussions on language features

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Major week for OCaml with 12 PRs merged including GC performance improvements, better error messages, and new memory statistics
entry.content:
Summary

Eight new PRs opened including major language features like include functor and tuple coercion, alongside completion of runtime improvements and error message enhancements

Activity

  • Runtime fiber cache fix by Florian Angeletti resolved cache miss issue where aligned fibers failed to use cache on reallocation (#14169)
  • Error message improvements delivered by Stefan Muenzel for quantifier mismatches and row type display in GADT error messages (#14111, #14147)
  • Memory profiling enhancements from Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni making memprof more compositional for multicore usage (#14053)
  • Major GC latency reduction by Nick Barnes introducing mark-delay performance improvement (#13580)
  • Build system fixes including deprecation alert locations by Florian Angeletti and test expectations by Stefan Muenzel (#14176, #14170)
  • New language features opened including include functor syntax by Olivier Nicole and tuple coercion across labels by Malek Ben Romdhane (#14177, #14180)
  • Tool fixes with ocamlmklib -L option ordering by Alexandre DOUARD addressing library search path issues (#14173)
  • Platform support expansion for Haiku native backend activation by Anarchos (#14138)
entry.summary: Major week for OCaml with 12 PRs merged including GC performance improvements, better error messages, and new memory statistics

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: Major language enhancement with polymorphic parameters, runtime performance optimizations, and new Hashtbl APIs
entry.content:
Summary

Runtime system improvements with memory management fixes and build system enhancements across multiple areas

Activity

  • Minor heap management fixes by Gabriel Scherer including proper domain initialization handling (#14158) and reservation resizing corrections (#14164)
  • Build system reliability improvements by David Allsopp addressing dependency generation when tools are disabled (#14159)
  • Runtime refactoring by Gabriel Scherer introducing clearer domain state categorization with parked/active/stopped classifications (#14161)
  • Code quality improvements including consistent memprof logging (#14157) and terminology updates for heap reservation (#14160)
entry.summary: Major language enhancement with polymorphic parameters, runtime performance optimizations, and new Hashtbl APIs

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Active week with 9 PRs merged, improved error messages for external declarations and type printing, plus GC and runtime fixes
entry.content:
Summary

New PRs opened for GADT error messages, type proxy refactoring, and module pattern distinctions alongside ongoing modular explicits documentation

Activity

  • New PRs opened include GADT equation printing in error messages by Stefan Muenzel (#14142), strong typing for Out_type proxies (#14156), and pattern distinction for (module M : S) vs (module M) : (module S) (#14149)
  • Runtime issues reported including custom runtime events behaving randomly in fast-paced environments by Mattias (#14151) and minor heap virtual memory reservation improvements needed by KC Sivaramakrishnan (#14153)
  • Documentation requests for library installation file conventions by Daniel BÃ¼nzli (#14154) and color flag affecting error message content by Ali Caglayan (#14144)
  • Ongoing work on modular explicits documentation by Gabriel Scherer (#14048) and monadic binding operators attributes support (#11398)
  • Long-standing bug in recursive module functor application approximation identified affecting GADT type checking by Ryan Tjoa (#14140)
entry.summary: Active week with 9 PRs merged, improved error messages for external declarations and type printing, plus GC and runtime fixes

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: Merged compiler bug fixes and ThreadSanitizer compatibility improvements with active thread safety analysis
entry.content:
Summary

Five new PRs opened including Haiku OS support and GADT error improvements alongside continued thread safety analysis

Activity

  • Five new PRs opened this week including Anarchos proposing Haiku OS native backend activation (#14138), Stefan Muenzel opening GADT error message improvements (#14142), and Daniel BÃ¼nzli adding stdlib string manipulation functions before closing for broader API discussion (#14125)
  • Compiler quality improvements merged including Stefan Muenzel delivering terminology cleanup across 40 files (#14141), Florian Angeletti fixing typechecker internal error (#14135) and C++ compatibility (#14139), plus Gabriel Scherer resolving pattern matching non-determinism (#14091)
  • ThreadSanitizer infrastructure completed with Hari Hara Naveen S merging comprehensive signature fixes for GCC 15 compatibility (#14082) and Kate providing performance optimizations (#14119)
entry.summary: Merged compiler bug fixes and ThreadSanitizer compatibility improvements with active thread safety analysis

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: Active week with standard library enhancements, signature merging fixes, and performance improvements across multiple areas
entry.content:
Summary

String API extensions debated, tooling improvements for project-wide indexing, and multiple module system refinements

Activity

  • New PRs opened include ClÃ©ment Blaudeau proposing structured diagnostics for the compiler (#14126), Vincent Laviron adding get_singleton functions to Set/Map (#14121), and Ulysse improving tooling with uid association for better project-wide indexing (#14120)
  • Standard library expansion discussed with Daniel BÃ¼nzli proposing String.{take,drop,span} functions with active debate over naming conventions, particularly the span function name (#14125)
  • Module system improvements by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau including signature merging refactoring (#14127) and fixes for recursive module signature constraints (#14100)
  • Performance optimizations delivered by Kate using is_empty instead of cardinal comparisons in Set/Map operations (#14119)
  • Documentation fixes merged including Jan Midtgaard correcting Float.frexp for negative numbers (#14128) and Pierre Rousselin clarifying Char.compare ASCII ordering (#14090)
entry.summary: Active week with standard library enhancements, signature merging fixes, and performance improvements across multiple areas

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Active week with OCaml 5.4 regression testing, CI infrastructure fixes, and type system improvements
entry.content:
Summary

High activity week with 11 new PRs focusing on OCaml 5.4 regression fixes and infrastructure improvements

Activity

  • Seven new PRs opened this week including effect handler extension by Michael Lee adding discontinue variant with effects (#14107), recursive module type fix by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau (#14100), and MSVC warning cleanup by David Allsopp (#14103)
  • CI infrastructure modernization by David Allsopp addressed GitHub Actions image updates with critical fixes for build system stability (#14102, #14109)
  • Code quality improvements merged including Samuel Vivien removing redundant normalizepackagepath function (#14110) and Florian Angeletti fixing documentation formatting (#14112)
  • Cross-platform compatibility enhanced with Windows i686 mingw-w64 time_t fixes and clang warning resolution for better multi-compiler support (#14114, #14109)
entry.summary: Active week with OCaml 5.4 regression testing, CI infrastructure fixes, and type system improvements

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Standard library enhancements with new Option and Dynarray functions, Domain API refinement, and substantial test infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple stdlib enhancements merged including Option predicates and Dynarray iteration, alongside test infrastructure improvements and platform compatibility work

Activity

  • Standard library expansion delivered through Gabriel Scherer adding Option.for_all and exists predicates (#13920) plus Dynarray.rev_iter and rev_iteri for reverse iteration (#12877)
  • Domain module API cleanup by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r renaming running_domain_count to the cleaner Domain.count function (#14096, #14086)
  • Cross-platform compatibility improvements through Antonin DÃ©cimo symmetrizing shared functions between Sys and Unix modules for better code maintainability (#13447)
  • Testing infrastructure overhaul by David Allsopp implementing comprehensive test harness for relocatable OCaml with tools covering bytecode, dynlink, link modes, and relocation scenarios (#14014)
  • ThreadSanitizer reliability enhanced by Olivier Nicole fixing flaky tests through better synchronization and de-instrumenting string/bytes writes (#14059)
  • Documentation and tooling refinements including Florian Angeletti fixing OCamldoc paragraph formatting (#14098), Tim McGilchrist adding sanitizer debug flags (#14085), and Gabriel Scherer addressing pattern matching determinism (#14091)
entry.summary: Standard library enhancements with new Option and Dynarray functions, Domain API refinement, and substantial test infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Performance improvements for Apple Silicon and ThreadSanitizer compatibility fixes delivered alongside comprehensive test infrastructure for relocatable OCaml
entry.content:
Summary

ThreadSanitizer compatibility improvements, type system error message enhancements, and module alias validation refinements

Activity

  • ThreadSanitizer compatibility work by Olivier Nicole addressing runtime crashes with new draft PR for false alarm fixes (#14075) and investigation of multiple OCaml programs under TSAN crashes (#14083)
  • Type system improvements delivered by Florian Angeletti with better error messages for universal type variable mismatches (#14076) and module alias validation refinements by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau (#14066)
  • Code generation enhancements including package constraint display improvements by Samuel Vivien (#14067) and GCC alignment warning fixes by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#14035)
  • CI and debugging infrastructure improvements with Tim McGilchrist adding debugger flags for sanitizer scripts (#14085) and David Allsopp switching back to ubuntu-latest in GitHub Actions (#13680)
  • Platform compatibility discussions including Android/Termux build failures due to missing pthread_cancel functionality (#14087) and DWARF debugging issues on macOS (#14062)
entry.summary: Performance improvements for Apple Silicon and ThreadSanitizer compatibility fixes delivered alongside comprehensive test infrastructure for relocatable OCaml

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Active week with Option.blend addition, Apple Silicon optimizations, GC fixes, and improved error messages across multiple merged PRs
entry.content:
Summary

Six PRs merged including standard library additions, compiler optimizations, bug fixes, and improved developer experience

Activity

  • Standard library enhancement with Option.blend function by Kate providing flexible optional value combination (#13995)
  • Apple Silicon performance optimization by KC Sivaramakrishnan introducing Sixtyfour memory chunk and stlr instruction usage for significant speedup (#14074)
  • Error message improvements by Florian Angeletti enhancing tuple label mismatch reporting and univar error pointing (#14070)
  • Documentation consistency fixes by Damien Doligez correcting fibonacci function definitions in manual (#14072)
  • Bug fixes including unused warning issue by Ulysse (#13956) and dynlink exception printer fix by Etienne Millon (#14071)
  • Developer tooling improvements with debugger loadpath fallback by Pierre Boutillier for better dune project debugging (#14063)
entry.summary: Active week with Option.blend addition, Apple Silicon optimizations, GC fixes, and improved error messages across multiple merged PRs

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: Eight PRs opened for language features, debugging tools, memory profiling, and standard library enhancements with three issues addressing runtime system concerns
entry.content:
Summary

Eight new PRs opened covering transparent ascription, debugger improvements, memprof enhancements, and hashtable API additions

Activity

  • Eight new PRs opened this week including transparent ascription first step by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau (#14064), debugger path resolution improvements by Pierre Boutillier (#14055, #14063), and hashtable API enhancements by Sacha Ayoun (#14060)
  • Memory profiling improvements delivered through multicore memprof compositional changes by Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni (#14053) and minor GC timing fix by Nick Barnes (#14057)
  • Runtime system testing enhanced with ThreadSanitizer test reliability improvements by Olivier Nicole (#14059) and type alias deprecation framework by @v-gb (#14054)
entry.summary: Eight PRs opened for language features, debugging tools, memory profiling, and standard library enhancements with three issues addressing runtime system concerns

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: Cross-compilation support for freestanding targets merged, multicore GC race condition fixed, Windows process handling improved
entry.content:
Summary

Seven new PRs opened including modular explicits documentation, four major multicore and platform fixes merged

Activity

  • Seven new PRs opened this week including Gabriel Scherer documenting modular explicits (#14048), Gabriel Scherer proposing AI contribution guidelines (#14052), and Malek Ben Romdhane implementing field getter syntax (#14042)
  • Multicore runtime improvements with Gabriel Scherer fixing critical shared heap race condition (#14025) and ongoing performance investigation by Nikos Gorogiannis for Facebook's Infer analyzer (#14047)
  • Platform compatibility enhancements through NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r improving Windows process handling (#14046) and @shym enabling freestanding target compilation (#13810)
  • Developer tooling fixes including Brandon Stride addressing infinite loop with -short-paths flag (#14037) and Keryan Didier fixing caml_sys_argv external function (#13714)
entry.summary: Cross-compilation support for freestanding targets merged, multicore GC race condition fixed, Windows process handling improved

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Generational stack scanning merged for ARM64/POWER/RISC-V, new Sys.runtime_executable API, and toplevel printer system improvements merged.
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including relocatable OCaml implementation and FlexDLL build improvements, with multiple runtime and compiler infrastructure merges.

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened this week: relocatable OCaml implementation by David Allsopp (#14244), FlexDLL build tools selection improvements by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#14034), and short-paths infinite loop fix for recursive modules by Brandon Stride (#14036)
  • Generational stack scanning milestone achieved with Xavier Leroy's implementation merged for ARM64, POWER, and RISC-V after extensive review by @miod-vallat, Gabriel Scherer, and Olivier Nicole (#13594)
  • Printer system unification completed with Pierre Boutillier and Gabriel Scherer merging generalized polymorphic #install_printer support for both toplevel and debugger (#13969)
  • Multiple infrastructure improvements delivered including memprof bigarray tracking by Stephen Dolan (#13675), ocamltest refactors by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#13962), and native debugger test sanitization (#14033)
  • FlexDLL submodule updated to version 0.44 with lib-dynlink-domains test re-enabled on Windows (#14032)
  • Parser and AST improvements with extension point/attribute handling for local structure items by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r (#14009) and structure/signature parsing uniformization (#14039)
  • Error message enhancements for recursive modules by shivam (#13608) and format breaking improvements by Florian Angeletti (#13853)
entry.summary: Generational stack scanning merged for ARM64/POWER/RISC-V, new Sys.runtime_executable API, and toplevel printer system improvements merged.

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Major atomic record fields feature merged alongside standard library enhancements and runtime fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Repository infrastructure improvements including CI matrix expansion and stale bot configuration changes

Activity

  • Atomic record fields implementation completed by @clef-men with comprehensive manual documentation by Gabriel Scherer, enabling thread-safe field access with %atomic.loc extension (#13404, #13991)
  • Standard library enhancements delivered by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r adding Unix.unsetenv for environment variable management and Option utilities with applicative-style binding operators (#14020, #13916)
  • Runtime stability fixes by BenoÃ®t Vaugon resolving memory corruption during demarshaling and by Gabriel Scherer fixing domain lock release on spawn failures (#14015, #13953)
  • Development infrastructure improvements including CI matrix expansion with optional Cygwin/static builds by David Allsopp and stale bot reconfiguration by Florian Angeletti to only mark issues stale without auto-closing (#14013, #14004)
  • Signature constraint refactoring by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau improving merge logic maintainability and compiler warning fixes by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#13911, #14024, #13970)
entry.summary: Major atomic record fields feature merged alongside standard library enhancements and runtime fixes

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Version bump to 5.5.0, parser refactoring for local constructs, documentation improvements, and important bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Eleven PRs merged including parser refactoring, CI improvements, bug fixes, and documentation updates

Activity

  • Parser and AST improvements delivered through multiple merged PRs including unified local construct handling by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r (#13839, #14008, #14009) and environment refactoring by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau (#14000)
  • CI infrastructure enhancements with optional test matrix expansion by David Allsopp adding Cygwin, static, and minimal build testing (#14013) plus relocatable OCaml test harness (#14014)
  • Bug fixes and maintenance including opam version fix by Jan Midtgaard (#14011), precondition comment updates (#14012), and stale bot configuration update by Florian Angeletti (#14004)
  • Documentation improvements including API anchors (#14002) and channel documentation refinements (#13982)
  • Open PRs addressing compilation issues including string operation fixes by Mark Shinwell for ARM64 crashes (#14010) and Windows API primitives work by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#13416)
entry.summary: Version bump to 5.5.0, parser refactoring for local constructs, documentation improvements, and important bug fixes

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Development branching week with internal refactoring, typing improvements, and recursive module bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Active week with new PRs for external types documentation, recursive function fixes, and executable header unification

Activity

  • New PRs opened include external types manual documentation by Gabriel Scherer (#13994), recursive function typing fixes by Samuel Vivien (#13984), and executable header unification by David Allsopp (#13988)
  • Internal flag refactoring completed with ClÃ©ment Blaudeau merging the no_alias_deps rename (#13972) and Kate adding Option.blend function (#13995)
  • Development milestone reached with 5.4 branch creation, version updates, and README badge updates to reflect new development cycle
entry.summary: Development branching week with internal refactoring, typing improvements, and recursive module bug fixes

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Major GC improvements with new ramp-up API, enhanced signal handling functions, and bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Active development in typing system, debugger support, and tooling improvements with multiple ongoing PRs

Activity

  • Typing system enhancements include polymorphic parameter work by Ulysse (#13971), occurrence check improvements for recursive types by Samuel Vivien (#13866), and principality warning fixes (#13973)
  • Native debugger support significantly expanded with multiple merged PRs by Tim McGilchrist and SÃ©bastien Hinderer covering GDB and LLDB integration (#13199, #13485, #13665, #13762, #13965)
  • Testing infrastructure improvements with ocamltest color support by Antonin DÃ©cimo (#13964) and multicore test workflow fixes by Jan Midtgaard (#13958)
  • Module system work ongoing with transparent modules flag renamed to no_alias_deps and module presence flag printing added to typedtree (#13963)
  • Build system updates including GitHub Actions upgrades to macOS 15/Xcode 16.3 and configure hygiene check fixes (#13935)
entry.summary: Major GC improvements with new ramp-up API, enhanced signal handling functions, and bug fixes

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Standard library improvements and runtime bug fixes including List.sort_uniq behavior change and lazy value compilation fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Two new issues opened covering spurious warnings and ocamltest environment handling plus ongoing work on major language features

Activity

  • Spurious unused warnings in OCaml 5.3 reported by Ulysse affecting functor arguments in signatures (#13955)
  • OCamltest environment variable handling issues reported by Olivier Nicole with complex behavior around variable scoping (#13941)
  • Modular explicits implementation by Samuel Vivien continues development with new syntax for module-dependent functions (#13275)
  • Type_external kind feature by Takafumi Saikawa adds abstract types with names for FFI purposes (merged #13712)
  • Polymorphic parameters extension by Ulysse enabling function parameters with polymorphic types (merged #13806)
entry.summary: Standard library improvements and runtime bug fixes including List.sort_uniq behavior change and lazy value compilation fixes

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Major standard library enhancements with new Result and List/Seq functions, comprehensive Fun module documentation, and runtime improvements.
entry.content:
Summary

Active PRs for flambda2 register allocation workaround and type unification improvements, plus ongoing discussions on Result API design and standard library evolution.

Activity

  • New PRs opened including flambda2 register allocation workaround by Vincent Laviron (#13931), ccomptype to ccomp_type rename by Gabriel Scherer (#13927), and build system improvements for Windows testing (#13932)
  • Standard library evolution with Daniel BÃ¼nzli contributing Result module enhancements (#13720, #13696) and David Allsopp adding singleton functions (#13932)
  • Documentation improvements with Haz providing comprehensive Fun module examples (#12452) and @v-gb enhancing alert documentation (#13924)
  • Runtime optimizations including Stephen Dolan's ephemeron minor GC improvements (#13643) and Gabriel Scherer's floatarray concatenation rewrite (#13362)
  • Build system maintenance with David Allsopp resolving Windows test issues and typo checking improvements (#13815)
entry.summary: Major standard library enhancements with new Result and List/Seq functions, comprehensive Fun module documentation, and runtime improvements.

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: New PR opened for signature constraint refactoring while several PRs merged covering array documentation and build system improvements
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for signature constraint refactoring while several established PRs continue development on type system improvements

Activity

  • New PR opened this week for signature constraint refactoring by ClÃ©ment Blaudeau (#13911), which proposes refactoring the merge_constraint function handling module type constraints with better organization and documentation
  • Ongoing major development continues on keep expansion improvements by Jacques Garrigue (#11648), addressing long-standing typechecker issues including non-termination and principality tracking problems
  • Runtime system improvements being developed by Gabriel Scherer for distinguishing blocking and non-blocking mutexes to prevent deadlock situations (#13716)
  • Polymorphic parameters feature by Ulysse allowing function parameters with polymorphic types has been successfully merged (#13806)
entry.summary: New PR opened for signature constraint refactoring while several PRs merged covering array documentation and build system improvements

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Standard library additions, lazy block optimizations, code generation improvements, and documentation updates merged
entry.content:
Summary

Package type refactoring merged after extensive development by Samuel Vivien, relocatable OCaml PRs opened by David Allsopp

Activity

  • Package type refactoring completed by Samuel Vivien with comprehensive changes storing Tpackage content in records for better type system consistency (#13856)
  • Major relocatable OCaml implementation opened by David Allsopp with --with-relative-libdir configuration option enabling portable compiler installations (#14244, #14247)
  • Error message system improvements merged converting hints to submessages for better user experience (#13838)
  • Unix testing infrastructure enhanced with new Windows ocamltest actions and cloexec test fixes by David Allsopp (#13879)
  • Type variance printing improvements merged for better compiler output (#13820)
  • Shape printer refactoring completed reducing whitespace and improving formatting (#13863)
  • Documentation updates for integer operations and stdlib module checking (#13852, #13877)
entry.summary: Standard library additions, lazy block optimizations, code generation improvements, and documentation updates merged

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: New variance debugging features merged alongside performance regression reports for OCaml 5
entry.content:
Summary

Performance regression discussions dominated activity with detailed reports from Semgrep and EasyCrypt teams

Activity

  • GC performance investigations initiated by Nat Mote from Semgrep reporting poor garbage collection behavior on OCaml 5, requiring space_overhead tuning to achieve OCaml 4 parity (#13868)
  • EasyCrypt performance regression reported by Pierre-Yves Strub showing extreme slowdowns from OCaml 4 to OCaml 5, with compilation times increasing from minutes to hours (#13849)
  • Variance feature development completed by Takafumi Saikawa and Jacques Garrigue with comprehensive variance debugging tools merged after extensive review process (#13820)
  • Standard library enhancements delivered including new Repr module and Float.Array.{equal,compare} functions expanding the stdlib API (#13755, #13836)
entry.summary: New variance debugging features merged alongside performance regression reports for OCaml 5

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Runtime safety improvements and bug fixes with enhanced error reporting utilities
entry.content:
Summary

Focused on runtime safety improvements and compiler tooling enhancements

Activity

  • Runtime safety work completed with root safety improvements in caml_register_named_value ensuring proper garbage collection behavior in C bindings (#13855)
  • Compiler tooling enhancements including bug fixes for AST printing with polymorphic type annotations (#13845) and improved error message alignment utilities
  • Build system improvements with iarray dune support placeholder and enhanced CI workflows for better cross-platform testing
  • Performance debugging discussion around OCaml 5 performance regression in EasyCrypt project with detailed analysis of weak table behavior (#13849)
  • ThreadSanitizer testing improvements addressing flaky test issues on different platforms (#13831)
entry.summary: Runtime safety improvements and bug fixes with enhanced error reporting utilities

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Runtime system improvements, error message enhancements, and compiler tooling additions with one new PR and discussions on signal handling
entry.content:
Summary

One new draft PR on C primitive hardening opened, plus one variance printing PR merged from earlier work

Activity

  • C primitive type hardening draft PR opened by Antonin DÃ©cimo to silence -Wcast-function-type warnings in GCC and clang (#13841)
  • Variance printing support merged with new -print-variance command-line option and Asttypes.Bivariant by Takafumi Saikawa (#13820)
  • Native debugger testing improvements skip tests when ThreadSanitizer is enabled to avoid conflicts (bf28aea)
entry.summary: Runtime system improvements, error message enhancements, and compiler tooling additions with one new PR and discussions on signal handling

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Active week with new stdlib features, ARM64 improvements, and ongoing language feature development
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened this week alongside merged PRs for type system enhancements and continued work on modular explicits

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened this week: Polymorphic Parameters by Ulysse adding function parameters with polymorphic types, and add -print-variance and Asttypes.Bivariant by Takafumi Saikawa for variance debugging support
  • Type system enhancements merged including Add a new type kind Type_external by Takafumi Saikawa and the variance printing functionality (#13820)
  • Ongoing major language features continue development with Modular explicits by Samuel Vivien receiving updates, and Structured diagnostics for the compiler by Florian Angeletti progressing
  • Standard library enhancements delivered through Format module improvements and runtime events extensions by multiple contributors
  • Platform support improvements with ARM64 optimizations and Windows-specific enhancements for better cross-platform compatibility
entry.summary: Active week with new stdlib features, ARM64 improvements, and ongoing language feature development

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Active week with labeled tuples feature, new stdlib modules Pqueue and String spellchecking, Unicode improvements, and ARM64 GC optimizations
entry.content:
Summary

Two major relocatable OCaml PRs opened covering portable compiler configuration with relative library paths and comprehensive bytecode runtime enhancements

Activity

  • Relocatable OCaml comprehensive implementation opened by David Allsopp with two major PRs introducing --with-relative-libdir configuration option (#14244) and massive collection of bytecode launcher enhancements, Windows path handling improvements, and build system refinements (#14247)
  • Language evolution with labeled tuples feature merged after extensive development providing optional field labels for tuples to improve code clarity and type safety
  • Standard library expansion with priority queue implementation and string processing utilities including edit distance algorithms for spellchecking applications
  • Unicode improvements across multiple modules including Format device width calculation and Uchar UTF-8 decoding utilities for better international text support
  • Performance optimizations through ARM64 prefetching support and GC improvements, plus type system enhancements for better code generation
  • Build system improvements including cross-compiler configuration simplification and Windows triplet validation for more robust builds
entry.summary: Active week with labeled tuples feature, new stdlib modules Pqueue and String spellchecking, Unicode improvements, and ARM64 GC optimizations

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Major week with immutable arrays implementation, new stdlib functions, garbage collection fixes, and extensive relocatable OCaml proposals
entry.content:
Summary

Three major PRs opened for relocatable OCaml implementation plus important garbage collection and runtime system bug fixes merged

Activity

  • Three major relocatable OCaml PRs opened by David Allsopp representing comprehensive redesign of OCaml's installation and runtime system (#14244, #14247)
  • Major garbage collection fixes merged including accurate live blocks/words stats in compaction (37948e2), shared pool owner correction on adoption (3597232), and major GC pacing bug fix for synchronous collections (21759223)
  • Runtime and tooling improvements including Type.Id extension constructor usage (66cae63), dynlink error string escaping (7283c51), and AppVeyor build configuration enhancements (941181162)
  • C++ API compatibility work by Antonin DÃ©cimo addressing compilation issues with C++ and improving header compatibility (#13777)
entry.summary: Major week with immutable arrays implementation, new stdlib functions, garbage collection fixes, and extensive relocatable OCaml proposals

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Documentation improvements for Seq module termination behavior, Flambda unboxing enhancements, and typecore refactoring
entry.content:
Summary

Three PRs opened this week including major relocatable OCaml proposals and structured diagnostics, plus merged improvements to Seq docs and compiler optimizations

Activity

  • Three new PRs opened this week including comprehensive relocatable OCaml implementation by David Allsopp (#14243, #14247) and structured compiler diagnostics by Florian Angeletti (#13766)
  • Documentation improvements merged with @hirrolot improving Seq module documentation to clarify termination behavior for infinite sequences (#13767)
  • Compiler optimization delivered through Flambda static catch parameter unboxing by Vincent Laviron, enabling better performance for functional code patterns (#13758)
  • Typecore refactoring completed by Samuel Vivien refactoring collect_apply_args function to prepare for new function kinds (#13744)
  • Native debugger improvements by David Allsopp fixing test output handling and blank line emission issues (#13762)
entry.summary: Documentation improvements for Seq module termination behavior, Flambda unboxing enhancements, and typecore refactoring

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Standard library API enhancements and manual improvements with one new PR opened for relocatable OCaml feature
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for relocatable OCaml while existing PRs continue development on native debugging documentation and external types

Activity

  • New relocatable OCaml PR opened: David Allsopp opened comprehensive PR for explicit-relative paths in ld.conf as first step toward relocatable OCaml implementation (#14243)
  • Native debugging documentation: Tim McGilchrist continues work on native debugger manual chapter with review feedback from Daniel BÃ¼nzli regarding source path handling and BUILDPATHPREFIX_MAP interactions (#13747)
  • Type system enhancements: Takafumi Saikawa progressing external type kind implementation coauthored with Jacques Garrigue, enabling provable type equality and distinguishing external types (#13712)
  • Comprehensive development: Repository maintained active development with merged bug fixes, documentation updates, and performance improvements across runtime system and standard library components
entry.summary: Standard library API enhancements and manual improvements with one new PR opened for relocatable OCaml feature

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Standard library enhancements and runtime improvements delivered with three new functions and performance optimizations
entry.content:
Summary

Notable repository activity includes a new GC safety issue report and ongoing Relocatable OCaml development with large-scale PRs

Activity

  • New issues: Jan Midtgaard reported parallel GC test segfaults and deadlocks with Gc.compact on macOS ARM64 affecting multiple OCaml versions (#13739)
  • Relocatable OCaml development: David Allsopp opened comprehensive PRs for relocatable OCaml implementation including explicit-relative paths in ld.conf (#14243) and a massive overview PR combining all relocatable changes (#14247) with 6787 additions across 161 files
  • Runtime system work: Gabriel Scherer continued development on distinguishing runtime and mutator mutex types (#13716) with discussion from maintainers about proper usage patterns and potential deadlock prevention
entry.summary: Standard library enhancements and runtime improvements delivered with three new functions and performance optimizations

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: OCaml 5.3.0 released with new Char.Ascii module and runtime fixes for multicore locking
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for type system and runtime improvements alongside OCaml 5.3.0 release

Activity

  • New PR opened by Takafumi Saikawa for adding Type_external kind to enable abstract type distinction and equality proofs (#13712)
  • New PR opened by Gabriel Scherer to distinguish runtime vs mutator mutexes for safer concurrent programming (#13716)
  • OCaml 5.3.0 released by Florian Angeletti featuring deep effect handlers syntax, restored MSVC port, re-introduced statistical memory profiling, and Unicode source file support
  • Runtime system fixes merged by Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni addressing multicore locking deadlocks and proper documentation of blocking vs non-blocking mutex usage (#13227, #13714)
  • Testing infrastructure updated by Jan Midtgaard bumping multicoretests to version 0.6 (#13726)
  • Documentation fixes by Duncan Holm for Dynarray (#13722) and community contributors for Ephemeron typos (#13730)
  • Windows and CI improvements by David Allsopp including symlink creation support (#13494) and Cygwin version pinning (#13718)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.3.0 released with new Char.Ascii module and runtime fixes for multicore locking

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: Major internal changes including new symbol mangling, unicode comment support, Bool module enhancements, and Windows build fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Single Windows-specific issue opened regarding runtop-with-otherlibs functionality on mingw32 and MSVC targets

Activity

  • Antonin DÃ©cimo opened issue about Windows runtop-with-otherlibs failing to load otherlibs with Unix module giving "dynamic loading not supported" error (#13704)
  • Extensive typing system improvements merged with labeled argument additions to typemod functions by multiple contributors (d75d775e, 85970ee1)
  • Build system modernization with updated autotools configuration and improved cross-compilation support (d23675111)
  • Test suite expansion including new frame pointer tests, Unicode comment tests, and debugger reference updates (ccbd123a, 385ab8f9)
entry.summary: Major internal changes including new symbol mangling, unicode comment support, Bool module enhancements, and Windows build fixes

entry.title: Week 52, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/ocaml - Week 52, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/ocaml - Week 52, 2024

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: New Bool module functions, manual improvements, runtime fixes, and major compiler refactoring merged
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive compiler refactoring by Samuel Vivien with typing system improvements and runtime optimizations

Activity

  • Major typing system refactoring by Samuel Vivien across multiple modules including improvements to type application handling (e74da11), typemod reorganization (6616961), pprintast refactoring (3480dbd), and typetexp improvements (af96835)
  • Runtime domain system improvements by @COCTI fixing generalization issues (2ca16da) and simplifying multicore detection (d89dd7b)
  • Build system enhancements by David Allsopp addressing cross-compilation challenges and CI infrastructure updates (f28bfbc, 523e6a6)
  • Documentation and manual improvements by Florian Angeletti expanding Unicode support and modernizing LaTeX rendering (multiple commits)
  • Debugging tools enhancements by Nick Barnes adding support for variable domain numbers in debugger scripts (0de4054)
entry.summary: New Bool module functions, manual improvements, runtime fixes, and major compiler refactoring merged

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Cross-compiler build system improvements, AMD64 performance optimization, and recursive module error message enhancements.
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/ocaml - Week 50, 2024
entry.summary: Cross-compiler build system improvements, AMD64 performance optimization, and recursive module error message enhancements.

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Frame pointer maintenance improvements, build system updates, and documentation fixes merged across multiple PRs
entry.content:
Summary

Five PRs merged covering frame pointer fixes, documentation improvements, build system upgrades, and runtime enhancements

Activity

  • Frame pointer maintenance delivered through Stephen Dolan's comprehensive fix ensuring correct OCaml frame pointer handling during stack reallocation when C libraries lack frame pointer support (#13635)
  • Documentation correction by @olejodd10 fixing Map.S.addtolist example documentation from [v] to [data] for clarity (#13664)
  • Build infrastructure modernization by Antonin DÃ©cimo updating to Automake 1.17, libtool 2.5.4, and refreshed GNU config files while removing unneeded Automake files (#13654)
  • Runtime enhancement by Florian Angeletti helping gcc static analyzer by widening test condition from len == -1 to len < 0 in startup_byt.c (#13661)
  • RISC-V platform fix by @dustanddreams and Nick Barnes correcting CFI annotations to use x19 as Canonical Frame Address register, preventing backtraces from being truncated when calling no-alloc C code (#13595)
entry.summary: Frame pointer maintenance improvements, build system updates, and documentation fixes merged across multiple PRs

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Major improvements to warning system UI, garbage collection performance, parser enhancements, and symbol name mangling updates merged this week
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive work on compiler internals including GADT type checking fixes, pattern matching improvements, and major garbage collection performance optimizations

Activity

  • GADT type checking enhancements merged with backtracking in Ctype.unify_gadt and optimized unification for better type inference by Jacques Garrigue (#13585)
  • Documentation and syntax fixes including typo corrections in HACKING.adoc and configure patterns by @shym (#13652)
  • Frame pointer handling fixes and amd64 assembly refactoring for better debugging support by Tim McGilchrist (#13639, #13050)
  • Runtime system improvements including mangling fixes for caml_system$frametable and TSan oracle updates (#13650, #13642)
  • Pattern matching compiler fixes for GADT cases and protection of retyping functions to resolve warning 56 false positives (#13600, #13598)
  • Parsing infrastructure updates with location tracking improvements and source printing fixes for escaped identifiers (#13603)
entry.summary: Major improvements to warning system UI, garbage collection performance, parser enhancements, and symbol name mangling updates merged this week

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: OCaml 5.2.1 release published with bug fixes, plus improvements to string operations and error message formatting
entry.content:
Summary

OCaml 5.2.1 release published alongside shared heap PR opened earlier, plus configure script and documentation improvements

Activity

  • OCaml 5.2.1 release published by Florian Angeletti containing bug fixes with downloadable assets already showing 35,397 downloads
  • Shared heap free list optimization PR opened by Sadiq Jaffer implementing run-length encoding for better sweep performance in sparse heaps, showing 3.85x speedup in synthetic benchmarks (#13616)
  • Configure script maintenance completed by Antonin DÃ©cimo with multiple commits cleaning up configure checks, removing obsolete math.h detection, and improving POSIX system assumptions (69551c2982a4e0c5150ddaee5807773785bdd37d, #13556)
  • Thread naming fixes implemented by Antonin DÃ©cimo addressing various platform-specific issues with thread name setting functionality (6c3dc598871ca0cb279cdb7ed9a047089326eca1, #13625)
  • Warning message formatting overhaul by Florian Angeletti enabling better structured error and warning output with improved formatting (75459af916ea82c7b8f1cf4dfc16272bf2130818, #13568)
  • Documentation improvements including configure regeneration guidance and build process documentation updates by Antonin DÃ©cimo (c484c6932fa2eae03ba0f5a7dbdb26e3eee65eb0, #13610)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.2.1 release published with bug fixes, plus improvements to string operations and error message formatting

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: GNU/Hurd native backend enablement, runtime bug fixes, and compiler numbers comparison fix
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for free list optimization while ongoing domain spawn error handling work continues

Activity

  • New shared heap optimization PR opened by Sadiq Jaffer implementing run-length encoding for free blocks to improve sweeping performance on sparse heaps (#13616)
  • Domain spawn error handling work continues with Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni addressing cleanup during failures, though PR remains in development (#12410)
  • Issue closure of recursive module error message improvement request by Zach Baylin after implementation via PR #13608 (#12628)
entry.summary: GNU/Hurd native backend enablement, runtime bug fixes, and compiler numbers comparison fix

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: New thread naming API, major GC improvements, linker warning fixes, and typechecker crash resolution merged this week.
entry.content:
Summary

Major GC performance optimization PR merged with substantial runtime improvements, plus typechecker crash fixes for object typing.

Activity

  • Major GC performance improvements delivered through Nick Barnes's "Mark-delay" optimization that reduces latent garbage delay by approximately half a major GC cycle (#13580)
  • Typechecker crash resolution for object typing scenarios fixed through generalization improvements in Typedecl.update_type (#13495, #13514)
  • Runtime consolidation work including atomic counter function unification and platform-specific assembly improvements across amd64, power, and s390x architectures
  • Build system enhancements merged for better developer experience with configure script updates and makefile variable restoration for compatibility
entry.summary: New thread naming API, major GC improvements, linker warning fixes, and typechecker crash resolution merged this week.

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: New `-keywords` flag introduced, major GC performance improvements merged, parallel flush bug reported
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for mark-delay GC performance improvement, existing Windows concurrency and type system PRs continue

Activity

  • Mark-delay GC performance improvement PR opened by Nick Barnes introducing sweep-only phase to reduce latent garbage delay by approximately half a GC cycle (#13580)
  • Windows concurrency primitives PR continues development by Antonin DÃ©cimo to remove winpthreads dependency and use modern Windows APIs for both MSVC and MinGW-w64 ports (#13416)
  • Type system fixes for object inheritance and class constraints remain in progress by Leo White, addressing multiple related issues including self type escaping (#12150)
  • Type expansion handling major overhaul by Jacques Garrigue continues to address non-termination and principality tracking issues (#11648)
entry.summary: New `-keywords` flag introduced, major GC performance improvements merged, parallel flush bug reported

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Week focused on runtime improvements, bytecode callbacks optimization, and Windows concurrency API modernization
entry.content:
Summary

Major Windows API modernization PR continues development alongside runtime performance improvements

Activity

  • Windows concurrency modernization continues with Antonin DÃ©cimo developing comprehensive WinAPI replacement for winpthreads in ongoing #13416
  • Runtime improvements merged including bytecode callback system rewrite (#13553), native code systhreads compilation fixes (#13520), and Dynlink private loading enhancements (#13376)
  • Compiler optimization work by Gabriel Scherer improving switch statement generation efficiency and build system cleanup (#13571, #13565)
  • Platform compatibility improvements with nanosleep usage (#13539) and GitHub Actions updates for better CI infrastructure
entry.summary: Week focused on runtime improvements, bytecode callbacks optimization, and Windows concurrency API modernization

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Core compiler maintenance with runtime events, typing improvements, and documentation updates

Activity

  • Runtime events enhancement by Thomas Leonard with addition of Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR event for better garbage collection monitoring (#13407)
  • Memory documentation improvement by @andyhhp adding discussion of CAMLnoreturn attribute usage in memory.h header (#13561)
  • Local module type substitution fix by Florian Angeletti addressing issue #13388 where local substitution could fail (#13540)
  • Manual clarification by Olivier Nicole disambiguating the -with-runtime option documentation (#12912)
  • Testsuite cleanup by @hhugo removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions for better jsofocaml compatibility (#13550)
  • Ongoing modular explicits development with Samuel Vivien continuing work on #13275, a feature for module-parametrized functions enabling convenient abstraction over higher-kinded types
entry.summary: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements

entry.title: Week 41, 2024: Active development week with multiple PRs merged covering performance optimizations, documentation improvements, and build system fixes
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/ocaml - Week 41, 2024
